definition: example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
Deutsch-Französische Jahrbücher (published once in 1844 by Karl Marx and bourgeois radical Arnold Ruge)

sentences.english: Historiography in the 20th century's most dazzling star of the Annales school in France.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪史学中最耀眼的新星是法国的年鉴学派。

sentences.english: I looked for Wyman's picture in my high-school annual.
sentences.chinese: 我在我的中学年鉴里找过怀曼的照片。

sentences.english: This year book ekes out souvenir of my life in the university.
sentences.chinese: 这本年鉴帮助我追忆大学生活。

sentences.english: The modernization researches carried on by Fernand Braudel, master historian of the French Annales School, bear unique characteristics of their own.
sentences.chinese: 法国年鉴学派大师布罗代尔的现代化研究独具特色。

sentences.english: The research is in the Annals of Internal Medicine.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发表在《内科科学年鉴》上。

sentences.english: And has achieved considerable success, the work was allocated to the Yearbook of China's advertising.
sentences.chinese: 并取得一定成绩，作品一度入编中国广告年鉴。

sentences.english: I would stick with A Sand County Almanac, and pass on Hands-On Environmentalism.
sentences.chinese: 我将继续支持一本沙县年鉴，并且转交实践的环境论。

sentences.english: The original data come from the statistical yearbook and government environmental notice.
sentences.chinese: 文章的原始数据均来自统计年鉴及政府环境公告。

sentences.english: Details about defining the dates can be found on the Almanack page.
sentences.chinese: 时间界定的详细细节在年鉴表页可以找到。

sentences.english: That's me -- this is my college yearbook photo.
sentences.chinese: 这个人是？就是我，这是我的大学年鉴照片。

sentences.english: It had burned up all their letters and their music and their yearbooks.
sentences.chinese: 那场火烧掉了他们所有的文件，曲谱和年鉴。

definition: a series of books/a collection of books
record of famous men/anthology of biographies
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
